text: Sara Elena Ramírez (; born August 31, 1975) is a Mexican-American actor, singer-songwriter and activist. They played the original Lady of the Lake in the 2005 Broadway musical Spamalot, winning a Tony Award. Ramírez was also in Grey's Anatomy, playing Dr. Callie Torres, the longest-running LGBT character in US television history Ramirez is openly bisexual and nonbinary, using they/them pronouns. They later played the bisexual, nonbinary roles of Kat Sandoval in Madam Secretary and Che Díaz in And Just Like That…, the modern reboot of Sex and the City. ==References== Category:1975 births Category:Living people Category:Mexican singer-songwriters Category:Mexican movie actors Category:Mexican stage actors Category:Mexican voice actors Category:Mexican television actors Category:Mexican activists Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American LGBT rights activists Category:Singer-songwriters from California Category:Tony Award winning actors Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:American television actors Category:Actors from San Diego Category:Singers from San Diego Category:Writers from San Diego Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT singers Category:American LGBT writers Category:LGBT people from California Category:American video game actors Category:Bisexual people Category:People from Sinaloa
title: Sara Ramirez
